response:
Urgent MRI is required to exclude compressive lesions and characterise demyelinating plaques; CSF analysis and serology help distinguish MS from NMOSD/MOGAD and other inflammatory, infectious or metabolic causes; baseline blood tests assess for mimics and ensure safety of high-dose steroids and later immunotherapy.

investigations = ["MRI of brain, orbits and whole spine with gadolinium", "Lumbar puncture with CSF cell count, protein, glucose, culture, cytology and oligoclonal bands", "Visual evoked potentials", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Vitamin B12 level", "Folate level", "Thyroid function tests", "Serum aquaporin-4 IgG antibody", "Serum MOG-IgG antibody", "Antinuclear antibody (ANA)", "Extractable nuclear antigen (ENA) panel including anti-Ro and anti-La", "Serum angiotensin converting enzyme (ACE)", "HIV serology", "Syphilis serology (VDRL/TPPA)", "Serum copper level", "Serum protein electrophoresis and immunofixation", "Urinalysis", "Chest CT or PET-CT if sarcoidosis or malignancy suspected on initial tests"]
